title: ChiBitCTy
author: ChiBitCTy
created_time: July 24, 2022, 07:52:04 PMLast edit: July 24, 2022, 08:27:15 PM by ChiBitCTy
content: Physicalbitcoin.com use to redirect right here to the collectibles board. This was a pretty great way to introduce people easily to the site and of course this board in particular. It seems the website is still under registration until next year, so any ideas what’s up with it right now or what might have happened?   www.physicalbitcoin.com

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on July 24, 2022, 07:52:04 PMPhysicalbitcoin.com use to redirect right here to the collectibles board. This was a pretty great way to introduce people easily to the site and of course this board in particular. It seems the website is still under registration until next year, so any ideas what’s up with it right now or what might have happened?   www.physicalbitcoin.comFrom what I can tell, the DNS has has multiple A records for it, so it resolves to one of the 4 different IP's below instead - Which don't seem to do anything (anymore)? but give ssl errors...  Whoever controls the domain's dns records just needs to fix all that I guess...  Code:$ dig physicalbitcoin.com; <<>> DiG 9.18.1-1ubuntu1.1-Ubuntu <<>> physicalbitcoin.com;; global options: +cmd;; Got answer:;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 44451;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 4, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 65494;; QUESTION SECTION:;physicalbitcoin.com.           IN      A;; ANSWER SECTION:physicalbitcoin.com.    24      IN      A       18.67.65.92physicalbitcoin.com.    24      IN      A       18.67.65.52physicalbitcoin.com.    24      IN      A       18.67.65.82physicalbitcoin.com.    24      IN      A       18.67.65.34

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: I would love if that domain redirected to this forum to get more people interested in this little niche pocket of the Bitcoin community.Also how much do think that domain name is worth? 25 - 50 BTC?Best,BTCOVERFIATS

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 25, 2022, 01:08:30 AMI would love if that domain redirected to this forum to get more people interested in this little niche pocket of the Bitcoin community.Also how much do think that domain name is worth? 25 - 50 BTC?Best,BTCOVERFIATSNo clue what it's worth, not my area I guess...  It did use to resolve here tho.. Chib, is that your domain? I can help with dns fixing if you need it, I recall us talking about this a long time ago I think but I cannot recall who owned it... All of those IP addresses have reverse dns pointing to various "cloudfront.net" servers, so I'm assuming that's who is hosting it. Code:$ dig -x 18.67.65.92;; QUESTION SECTION:;92.65.67.18.in-addr.arpa.      IN      PTR;; ANSWER SECTION:92.65.67.18.in-addr.arpa. 20889 IN      PTR     server-18-67-65-92.iad89.r.cloudfront.net.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 25, 2022, 01:08:30 AMI would love if that domain redirected to this forum to get more people interested in this little niche pocket of the Bitcoin community.Also how much do think that domain name is worth? 25 - 50 BTC?Best,BTCOVERFIATSI would highly doubt it would be worth even close to that. My opinion anyhow.Quote from: owlcatz on July 25, 2022, 02:53:31 AMQuote from: BTCOVERFIATS on July 25, 2022, 01:08:30 AMI would love if that domain redirected to this forum to get more people interested in this little niche pocket of the Bitcoin community.Also how much do think that domain name is worth? 25 - 50 BTC?Best,BTCOVERFIATSNo clue what it's worth, not my area I guess...  It did use to resolve here tho.. Chib, is that your domain? I can help with dns fixing if you need it, I recall us talking about this a long time ago I think but I cannot recall who owned it... All of those IP addresses have reverse dns pointing to various "cloudfront.net" servers, so I'm assuming that's who is hosting it. Code:$ dig -x 18.67.65.92;; QUESTION SECTION:;92.65.67.18.in-addr.arpa.      IN      PTR;; ANSWER SECTION:92.65.67.18.in-addr.arpa. 20889 IN      PTR     server-18-67-65-92.iad89.r.cloudfront.net.No, unfortunately is not my domain. I kind of figured who’s ever domain it is, is likely someone who’s a member/regular here or at least was at some point. Would be nice if it ended up being fixed. Really was a nice gesture by whomever initially set it up and a great and easy way to share this exact board with people.
